An annually improving survival rate of around 80% is contributing to creation of new forests. Of this year’s seedlings prepared for planting 52% account for agroforestry trees. Forestry trees on the other hand account for 47% and the remaining are ornamental trees. (6/6)
This has generated around 1.3 Bn ETB in income in wages. You can imagine the impact of these jobs at the household level. (5/6)

The proliferation of more than 120,000 nursery sites throughout the country has enabled job creation for various sections of society. Resultantly over 183 thousand permanent and temporary jobs have been created as a direct outcome of our greening endeavors. (4/6)

One of the key successes of the Green Legacy initiative has been instrumental in mobilizing millions and creating public awareness, thereby leading to significant decline in the rate of deforestation over the past couple of years. (3/6)

There seems to be an erroneous perception that by promoting Green Legacy and agricultural endeavors the government is uninterested in addressing security challenges and mourning the loss of lives. Such perceptions are skewed and purposely misleading. (2/6)

Principles that are to guide the process: Respect for the Constitutional Order, our Fundamental National Interests, the African Union as the facilitator of the process in accordance with the principle African Solutions to African Problems. (3/3)

We aspire to move towards reconstruction, rehabilitation & reconciliation of communities affected by the conflict. We want to avoid further bloodshed & end the suffering and misery occasioned by the conflict. We want to foster national consensus through national dialogue. (2/3)

Factors & considerations of the peace process decision: We've always preferred peace & have been forced into conflict. Peace is essential for our political & economic reform initiatives to succeed. GoE wants to put an end to this tragic chapter in our history & move forward(1/3)

It is to be recalled that the National Security Council set a direction two months ago to undertake various rule of law enforcement and terrorism countering measures and therefore the security sector has been working in accordance. (4/5)

There is a geopolitical underpinning to security threats within the country that are intensified through errand runners locally. Those in need of assistance as a direct outcome of these attacks are currently being supported. (3/5)

It is not an isolated incident and has been purposely designed to foment deep divisions between ethnic Oromos & ethnic Amharas that in unity topped a TPLF hegemony while victims comprise ethnic Amharas, Oromos & Gumuz. (2/5)

TPLF continues to forcefully conscript people into its forces. Its atrocities will disrupt agricultural activities & further exacerbate the humanitarian crisis in Tigray region. Any offence by the TPLF would undermine GoE's effort to avoid another round of conflict. (4/4)

The international community is encouraged to intensify its effort to meet the humanitarian needs in Ethiopia, including for the Tigray Region. TPLF appears to prepare for another offence during the coming farming season. Food & non-food items are not reaching the needy. (3/4)

GoE has continued to expedite the supply of food & other humanitarian supplies to reach Tigray region. The misconception that the GoE obstructs humanitarian assistance continues unabated. In fact, the Gov’t has redoubled its efforts to expedite assistance to all in need. (2/4)

As it pertains to humanitarian assistance in the N. Ethiopia, through the GoE’s declaration of an indefinite humanitarian truce, the supply of humanitarian assistance continues to show progress. As of June 3, 2022 data from NDRMC: (1/4) https://t.co/Ytw9gDLtLY
Humanitarian Assistance in Northern Ethiopia: THREAD

In the immediate term, the GoE has responded early & intensified national efforts to enhance the effectiveness of DRM. B/n July 2021 & May 2022 3.2M beneficiaries have received food assistance Oromia, Somali & SNNP regions (NDRMC). (3/3)

Ethiopia has put in place several policies & institutional measures with mitigation & adaptive programs. Additionally, through Ethiopia’s Home-Grown Economic Reforms, cluster farming and irrigation-based lowland wheat production continue strengthened. (2/3)

The HoA continues to be affected by climate change induced drought. Hence why GoE's mid to long term emphasis is on the Green Legacy initiative as a means of mitigating the consequences of climate change. Some parts of Ethiopia have unfortunately been experiencing droughts.(1/3) https://t.co/LsOaHsOvww

RT @AbiyAhmedAli: This morning we have began Prosperity Party’s executive committee meeting to discuss key national as well as party agenda…

Regarding South Sudan: We are having discussions at the government level to address concerns.
#PMAbiyresponds https://t.co/riB3oYUnIi

Regarding Citizens in Saudi: The challenge for the GoE is the large number of illegal immigrants. There are also reports of mercenaries. The necessary research will be done to separate our citizens from the culprits & repatriate them. #PMAbiyresponds https://t.co/gEz0mibcRw

Diplomacy & Deployment: Diplomats are appointed & not employed. As promised, we are implementing new trainings & practices. Many of our military diplomats will be supporting the defense forces from wherever they are stationed. #PMAbiyresponds https://t.co/pVHk1dPgiy

Ethiopia should not be the sole country to encourage the signing and implementation of the CFA with the lower riparian countries. For their own benefit, all countries are compelled to join. (2/2) #PMAbiyresponds https://t.co/5HHWPaZIIJ

Regarding the GERD & the Red Sea: we want to collaborate with Egypt and Sudan. As promised, we are generating energy and releasing pure water. The water from Abbay is available to all three countries. We are ready as long as there is a solution that benefits all of us. (1/2)

Regarding the Drought: Humanitarian assistance in giving access to nutritious food & immunizations served as a short-term remedy that. Cattle have been severely harmed. Water conservation, market links, and broad cloud seeding are among our long-term alternatives.#PMAbiyresponds https://t.co/250nZYI32z

Citizens who have given their lives in the service of their country have received the highest reward in the strengthening of their country. However, it would be unimaginable to leave these heroes behind as we go on. (2/2) #PMAbiyresponds https://t.co/R5F2sA9vHr
On the statutes, charter, and constitution of our country, much research, discussion, and decision-making is required which will take place going forward. (1/2)

Regarding engagement of competing parties: It's crucial to keep in mind that they have a say in cabinet and government decisions which will continue extensively. The national consultation process will also enable conducive context for further collaboration. #PMAbiyresponds https://t.co/UVTNYx2UHY

Regarding Special Forces: every region needs police forces. As a result, developing and implementing standard operational procedures for training and practice is the best option. We need to work out a way to maintain the balance so that our country is benefited. 
#PMAbiyresponds https://t.co/ETA8d3Y9IT

Regarding OLF Shene: Although security forces are deployed throughout the area, Shene avoids engaging in direct combat but rather slaughters innocent people. We need to approach the communities that keep them in hiding, hold discussions and work out solutions.
#PMAbiyresponds https://t.co/uVTymn7oFF

As a result, true triumph necessitates victory in the realm of peace. This decision has greatly helped Ethiopia. We must not compromise on decisions for the lasting good of the country. (3/3)
#PMAbiyresponds https://t.co/vPBiTxIRD1

In a  war, there is no such thing as a total triumph. When one party wins a combat while the other party is momentarily defeated, this is known as temporary victory. In turn, the defeated party would resurrect and assault. (2/3)

Concerning the Freed Prisoners: We must be cautious not to fall prey to the enemy's scheme. We released the prisoners for three reasons: to bring lasting peace, taking into consideration the overall situation of the prisoners, and to consolidate our victory. (1/3)

Regarding Afar: now, the international community has no grounds to accuse Ethiopia. It's worth noting that the attack is an attempt to hinder humanitarian aid. To alleviate the situation, the GoE is working closely with the regional government of Afar. #PMAbiyresponds https://t.co/3LmRvAdGl2

Negotiation is the upcoming all-inclusive national consultation. The Commissioners of the newly constituted National Dialogue Commission have simply been given the task of coming up with proposals; the Ethiopian people will make the final decisions. (2/2)
#PMAbiyresponds https://t.co/HwgqLsAK85

Negotiation:There has been no negotiation yet. This does not rule out the possibility of discussions. Negotiation is a method of identifying problem-solving options. We have been betrayed while making efforts to rebuild acknowledging that the region is a part of our country.(1/2)

The Reform Process: Reform is a process that needs time even in top government structures. In all of this, it is promising to have Ethiopians who work even during the night.
#PMAbiyresponds https://t.co/aLAsWQrlUB

Corruption: As far as we've come in terms of enhancing environmental ergonomics & ICT in government agencies, we still have a long way to go in terms of preventing corruption. Investigative journalism is encouraged. We are also performing evaluations.
#PMAbiyresponds https://t.co/G48GbcXLkk

Inflation: We need to encourage family planning, take steps to prevent businesses from stockpiling key commodities, and boost consumer confidence while seeking to keep costs down.
#PMAbiyresponds https://t.co/BuTKFKoMZc

Foreign direct investment has surged by 23% in the last six months. The number of business licenses increased by 10%, with 8% of renewing already existing business licenses. Our systems, however, need to be upgraded and modernized. #PMAbiyresponds https://t.co/oW8n3OJpSw

Developing our lakes: From the #DineforEthiopia project, Gorgora & Koisha will be completed this year, with the exception of Wonchi. Once we complete these, others will begin. #PMAbiyresponds https://t.co/bVdqAoUCYS

#GreatEthiopianHomecoming has yielded encouraging outcomes as a result of the contribution by the diaspora. We call up on Muslim diaspora to return home for Ramadan and continue their contributions. #PMAbiyresponds https://t.co/ozO7ZLpcnd

Agriculture: Cluster farming is a productive and profitable method of mechanized farming that has to be widely adopted by our farmers. 
Industry: Encouragement of indigenous production and reduction of imports should continue to be emphasized in the industry. #PMAbiyresponds https://t.co/JCmLyspK1D

Inflation: Food commodities, various causes Population, stockpiles, and consumer risk

When our exports exceed our imports, our country benefits. Banks' net value, which was ETB 1.8 trillion six months ago, has increased by ETB 2 trillion, while stakeholders' wealth has increased as well. Over the last six months, loans to private investors have improved. (2/2) https://t.co/qW52bkTOMq

#PMOEthiopia

Some of the main duties of this body would include identifying agenda items for national consensus, identifying stakeholders, convening dialogue platforms & crafting implementation processes for recommendations coming out of the national dialogue. (4/4)

The legal, justice & democracy affairs standing committee of the HoPR undertook a consultation with various stakeholders to garner inputs to the draft proclamation which will open up another phase in Ethiopia’s democratization process anchored in inclusivity.  (3/4)

This National Dialogue Commission is envisaged to be an independent democratic institution with reporting lines to the HoPR and acting with an independent mandate to bridge differences and chart an inclusive way forward for national understanding and alignment. (2/4)

Following the formation of a new government, one of the commitments made was to create a homegrown inclusive space to address various contestations. Resultantly, the Council of Ministers’ decision to form a National Dialogue Commission is testament to this commitment. (1/4)
National Dialogue: THREAD

It does not make sense to rally behind a new investigation looking into the same period as the recent investigation simply because some did not get the results they anticipated. That in essence is abusing international norms and resources. (4/5)

The resolution is rejected by GoE as it is a politically motivated instrument that is set to discredit efforts undertaken prior & recommendations put forth by the Joint UN Human Rights Office & the Ethiopian Human Rights Commission in their investigation report. (3/5)

The resolution decides to establish an international commission of human rights experts with a mandate to conduct investigation into allegations of human rights violations. Ethiopia has rejected it from its inception & most African & other friendly countries have voted “No”.(2/5)

By the end of last week, the UNHRC in Geneva had endorsed by a simple majority vote a resolution titled “Human Rights Situation in Ethiopia” which was drafted and tabled mainly by the member states from the European Union.  (1/5)
Human Rights Council: THREAD

Public documents in financial and legal institutions were destroyed. Kombolcha as an industry hub has been rendered inoperable through the theft and destruction of TPLF. In liberated areas, communities that had been displaced due to TPLF’s violence are slowly returning. (3/3)

The aftermath of TPLF’s occupation has been tremendous destruction of public and private infrastructure. Health infrastructures, academic institutions including Wollo University, religious institutions & cultural centres have been looted & severely destructed.  (2/3)

The ENDF & allies have made considerable gains in reversing the occupation by TPLF of Amhara and Afar towns the most recent being the full clearing out of TPLF from N. Wollo zone & liberating its strategic capital Woldia. (1/3)
Current State of Play: THREAD
Tigray: The most recent update is that a total of 225 trucks have arrived into Tigray with humanitarian supplies and reached Mekelle with a total of 9,284 MT food and non-food items. (4/4)

Afar: More than 1.3M people are in need of immediate Emergency Response. Close to 400,000 are displaced from 21 woredas. The Government together with partners  is helping in conflict affected areas. (3/4)

Amhara Region (ctd.): 9,055qtls of food distributed to Bati, Artumafursi, Dewe Harewa, Jile Timuga, Dawa Chaffa woredas in Oromia Zone. 21,368qtls of different kind of food dispatched to Gashena, Lalibela, Wadla, and Lasta woredas. (2/4)

Amhara: Following the recent military victories against TPLF, GoE has distributed 1,316qtls of food to Woldiya, Qobo & Mersa Woredas in N. Wollo Zone.  31,899qtls of food was distributed to Ataye, Efrata, Antsokiya, Shewarobit, Menz-Mama, Menz-Gera Weredas in N. Shewa Zone. (1/4)

and he also shared examples of the enhanced democratic practices being experienced in the country for the first time and affirmed his government’s priority to domestic and regional peace as a first priority. (3/5)
